messages.subject: looking for books on puberty for 11yob.
messages.msgSnippet: What s Going on Down There: Answers to Questions Boys Find Hard to Ask by Karen Gravelle, Nick Castro (Contributor), Chava Castro, Robert Leighton
messages.messageBody:
What's Going on Down There: Answers to Questions Boys Find Hard to Ask
by Karen Gravelle, Nick Castro (Contributor), Chava Castro, Robert Leighton
(Illustrator)

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0802775403/103-6430568-2731800?vi=glance

highly recommended by my 15 yr old boy who read it in one sitting when he
was 12 and has read only two books since then!

cris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] looking for books on puberty for 11yob.
messages.msgSnippet: From: momo3kaj  ) Any personal recommendations/favorites would be appreciated.
messages.messageBody:
From: "momo3kaj" <scott-wecht@...>


<<(...and for a Mom who has never been a 11yob!! <g>) Any personal
recommendations/favorites would be appreciated.
Thanks,>>


Well the two books I have aren't just talking about puberty issues. They
talk about everything from that to having babies. Pretty good and rather
light reading. The kind my kids have just picked up and skimmed through the
parts that interested them. They are 7 and 8. Boy and girl stuff too.

Asking About Sex and Growing Up by Joanna Cole

What's Happening To Me? by Peter Mayle



Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] looking for books on puberty for 11yob.
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/21/03 7:04:36 AM, scott-wecht@erols.com writes: ) Any personal
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/21/03 7:04:36 AM, scott-wecht@... writes:

<< (...and for a Mom who has never been a 11yob!! <g>) Any personal

recommendations/favorites would be appreciated. >>

I got Kirby a copy of a little paper back (little novel size, I mean) called
(I think) "What's Happening to my Body?"

When Marty was a little older, I got him a copy too (used bookstore, both
times) and he said "I already read Kirby's," and I said he should keep it anyway
in case he wanted to check something a few years up the line, or in case one
of his friends needed to borrow it.

I looked it up. <g>

Amazon has LOTS for sale, used, some less than a dollar (plus shipping). One
14 cents. <g>

I guess it's very commonly available!!

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0937858994/ref=pd_sim_books_1/10
4-7394958-0519107?v=glance&s=books


Sandra
